Sentencas: One of the most common problems in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is the delamination and thus the degradation of electrode/electrolyte interface which occurs in the consequences of the stresses generated within the different layers of the cell.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: Nowadays, the modeling of this problem under certain conditions is one of the main issues for the researchers.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: The structural and thermo-physical properties of the cell materials (i.e. porosity, density, Young's modulus etc.) are usually assumed to be homogenous in the mathematical modeling of solid oxide fuel cells at macro-scale.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: However, during the real operation, the stresses created in the multiphase porous layers might be very different than those at macro-scale.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: Therefore, micro-level modeling is required for an accurate estimation of the real stresses and the performance of SOFCs.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: This study presents a microstructural characterization and a finite element analysis of the delamination and the degradation of porous solid oxide fuel cell anode and electrode/electrolyte interface under various operating temperatures, compressing forces and material compositions by using the synthetically generated microstructures.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: A multi physics computational package (COMSOL) is employed to calculate the Von Misses stresses in the anode microstructures.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: The maximum thermal stress in the electrode/electrolyte interface and three phase boundaries is found to exceed the yield strength at 900 degrees C while 800 degrees C is estimated as a critical temperature for the delamination and micro cracks due to thermal stress generated.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: The thermal stress decreases in the grain boundaries with increasing content of one of the phases (either Ni or YSZ) and the porosity of the electrode.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure

Sentencas: A clamping load higher than 5 kg cm(-2) is also found to exceed the shear stress limit.
Titulo: Three dimensional stress analysis of solid oxide fuel cell anode micro structure
